comment.author: 77345821@N06
comment._content: This aircraft was sent to Canada after the war as part of the "War Booty" of materiel. It was then appropriated with several other aircraft by Billy Bishop and Billy Barker for a venture that they were involved in. It was used in a cross country race in the US, flown by Billy Barker, the VC ace who was severely wounded in his Sopwith Snipe in October 1918. Despite a useless left arm, he managed to keep flying. The number 50 on the side was crudely painted on for the aerial race and not a wartime insignia. Other photos existe where a slight black outline was painted around the numerals.
